discover.instruction: Read these instructions. Notice the highlighted verbs at the beginning.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай эти инструкции. Обрати внимание на выделенные глаголы в начале.

content.text:
How to make tea:
1. <highlight>Boil</highlight> some water.
2. <highlight>Put</highlight> a tea bag in a cup.
3. <highlight>Pour</highlight> the hot water into the cup.
4. <highlight>Wait</highlight> for 3-5 minutes.
5. <highlight>Remove</highlight> the tea bag.
6. <highlight>Add</highlight> milk or sugar if you like.
7. <highlight>Enjoy</highlight> your tea!

Important: <highlight>Don't</highlight> use boiling water for green tea. <highlight>Be</highlight> careful with hot water!
content.question: What is special about these verbs? Who is the subject?
content.question_ru: Что особенного в этих глаголах? Кто является подлежащим?

points.example: Open the door. Sit down. Listen!
Don't run! Don't be late. Don't forget!
Stop! (command) Turn left. (instruction) Take an umbrella. (advice) Have a cookie! (offer)
Please sit down. Close the door, please.

notice.instruction: Find all imperatives. Identify: command, instruction, advice, or offer?
notice.instruction_ru: Найди все повелительные формы. Определи: команда, инструкция, совет или предложение?

tasks.text: Classroom rules: Come to class on time. Don't be late. Bring your books every day. Listen to the teacher. Don't use your phone in class. Raise your hand to ask a question. Don't eat or drink in the classroom. Help your classmates. Be respectful. Have a great year!

notice.reflection_question: Why don't we use 'you' in these sentences?
notice.reflection_question_ru: Почему мы не используем 'you' в этих предложениях?

produce.instruction: Write 5 rules for your home or classroom using imperatives.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши 5 правил для дома или класса, используя повелительное наклонение.
produce.example: Keep the room clean. Don't leave your things on the floor. Be quiet after 10 PM. Don't eat in the bedroom. Respect others. Help with housework. Don't forget to lock the door.
criteria: Uses base verb for positive imperatives
Uses Don't + verb for negative imperatives

texts.title: Recipe: Scrambled Eggs
texts.content: Break two eggs into a bowl. Add salt and pepper. Beat the eggs with a fork. Heat butter in a pan. Pour the eggs into the pan. Stir gently. Don't overcook them. Remove from heat. Serve immediately. Enjoy!

texts.title: Safety Instructions
texts.content: In case of fire: Stay calm. Don't panic. Leave the building immediately. Don't use the elevator. Use the stairs. Go to the meeting point. Don't go back inside. Call the fire department. Wait for help. Follow all instructions from emergency services.

texts.title: Gym Rules
texts.content: Welcome to our gym! Bring a towel. Wipe equipment after use. Don't drop weights. Put equipment back. Don't use phones in the gym area. Wear appropriate clothes. Don't leave belongings unattended. Respect other members. Have a great workout!

texts.title: Travel Tips
texts.content: Pack light. Bring comfortable shoes. Don't forget your passport. Make copies of important documents. Learn a few words in the local language. Don't carry too much cash. Be open to new experiences. Take many photos. Try local food. Enjoy your trip!

texts.title: Study Advice
texts.content: Find a quiet place to study. Turn off your phone. Don't study for too long without breaks. Take short breaks every hour. Drink water. Don't skip sleep. Review your notes regularly. Ask questions. Don't be afraid to make mistakes. Believe in yourself!
